channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Greenland, tariffs and NATO: a rollercoaster week in transatlantic relations
item.description: After President Trump's upheaval at Davos, U.S. allies are openly questioning whether Washington can still anchor the rules-based order.
item.content:encoded: After President Trump's upheaval at Davos, U.S. allies are openly questioning whether Washington can still anchor the rules-based order.
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx

item.title: Two feet of snow possible in the Northeast as the storm pushes east and temperatures plunge
item.description: A dangerous winter storm is cutting across the nation's midsection, from New Mexico all the way up through Maine. More than 100,000 customers lost their power, and thousands of weekend flights were cancelled.
item.content:encoded: A dangerous winter storm is cutting across the nation's midsection, from New Mexico all the way up through Maine. More than 100,000 customers lost their power, and thousands of weekend flights were cancelled.
item.dc:creator: Jeff Brady

item.title: Federal officers kill a man in Minneapolis, and DHS offers few details
item.description: Federal immigration officers shot and killed a U.S. citizen on Saturday in Minneapolis, drawing hundreds of protesters in a city already shaken by another fatal shooting earlier this month. DHS says the man was armed and "violently resisted" arrest but refused to answer further questions.
item.content:encoded: Federal immigration officers shot and killed a U.S. citizen on Saturday in Minneapolis, drawing hundreds of protesters in a city already shaken by another fatal shooting earlier this month. DHS says the man was armed and "violently resisted" arrest but refused to answer further questions.
item.dc:creator: Eric Westervelt

item.title: How an NPR reporting team covered Gaza, when only one could be there
item.description: NPR's Daniel Estrin and Anas Baba reflect on how their reporting partnership across Tel Aviv and Gaza changed after October 7th, 2023.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Daniel Estrin and Anas Baba reflect on how their reporting partnership across Tel Aviv and Gaza changed after October 7th, 2023.
item.dc:creator: Linah Mohammad

item.title: Billions owed: 'The Debt' podcast covers the South's long fight to repay public HBCUs
item.description: A long-running fight over how to calculate and repay state funding debts to public HBCUs is flaring across the South, and Emily Siner and Camellia Burris tell the story in their podcast 'The Debt' from Nashville Public Radio
item.content:encoded: A long-running fight over how to calculate and repay state funding debts to public HBCUs is flaring across the South, and Emily Siner and Camellia Burris tell the story in their podcast 'The Debt' from Nashville Public Radio
item.dc:creator: Mallory Yu

item.title: Why a century-old tile game is suddenly drawing younger players
item.description: A surge of interest in mahjong is building new, in-person community in Washington D.C. as players look for joy, connection, and time off their phones.
item.content:encoded: A surge of interest in mahjong is building new, in-person community in Washington D.C. as players look for joy, connection, and time off their phones.
item.dc:creator: Mia Venkat

item.title: Minneapolis emergency management director invokes Yemen and Ukraine to describe events at home
item.description: Reaction from Minneapolis Emergency Management Director Rachel Sayre to Saturday's shooting and the subsequent street confrontations.
item.content:encoded: Reaction from Minneapolis Emergency Management Director Rachel Sayre to Saturday's shooting and the subsequent street confrontations.
item.dc:creator: Avery Keatley

item.title: Reporters describe covering a massive immigration sweep on the ground in Minneapolis
item.description: For two weeks, Minneapolis has seen protests and clashes between demonstrators and federal immigration agents, as the administration continues its aggressive campaign to arrest undocumented immigrants.
item.content:encoded: For two weeks, Minneapolis has seen protests and clashes between demonstrators and federal immigration agents, as the administration continues its aggressive campaign to arrest undocumented immigrants.
item.dc:creator: Jasmine Garsd

item.title: Is Greenland really a land of untapped riches? A geologist went looking in the 1990s
item.description: Is Greenland a land of rare earth riches? The Indicator tells the story of an Australian geologist who learned the great cost of extracting Greenland's minerals.
item.content:encoded: Is Greenland a land of rare earth riches? The Indicator tells the story of an Australian geologist who learned the great cost of extracting Greenland's minerals.
item.dc:creator: Darian Woods

item.title: Winter storm front has entered Texas
item.description: A large winter storm is expected to bring widespread heavy snow, sleet, and freezing rain from the Southern Rockies and Plains into the Mid-South beginning Friday.
item.content:encoded: A large winter storm is expected to bring widespread heavy snow, sleet, and freezing rain from the Southern Rockies and Plains into the Mid-South beginning Friday.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Weber
